CurrencyParameter.name: currency
CurrencyParameter.description: Please provide at least one of the following query params: currency, railType. Eg. Setting 'currency' to 'usd' without setting 'railType' and 'paymentRail' will return all usd accounts under any railType or paymentRail.

RailTypeParameter.name: railType
RailTypeParameter.description: Please provide at least one of the following query params: currency, railType. Eg. Setting 'railType' to 'offramp' without setting 'currency' and 'paymentRail' will return all offramp accounts under any currency or paymentRail.

DestinationCurrencyParameter.name: destinationCurrency
DestinationCurrencyParameter.description: usdt is allowed only on ETHEREUM_MAINNET at this moment

schema.description: Choose POLYGON_MAINNET for production, POLYGON_AMOY for sandbox.

VALimitParameter.name: limit
VALimitParameter.description: Number of micro deposit records return for the virtual account, default to 10 maximum to 100

VACreatedBeforeParameter.name: createdBefore
VACreatedBeforeParameter.description: Return the micro deposit records that created before this eventId

VACreatedAfterParameter.name: createdAfter
VACreatedAfterParameter.description: Return the micro deposit records that created after this eventId

UserTypeParameter.name: userType
UserTypeParameter.description: If userType is passed, you will get all users under the type.

ChainParameter.name: chain
ChainParameter.description: The blockchain network to retrieve the balance from. Currently, only POLYGON_MAINNET is supported in production and only POLYGON_AMOY is supported in sandbox.

CryptoCurrencyParameter.name: currency
CryptoCurrencyParameter.description: The type of currency to check the balance for. Currently, only USDC is supported.

rail.description: Passing "US_ACH_WIRE" allows the user to do USD onramp through both ACH and Wire.

streetLine1.description: This has to be a valid street address.

streetLine2.description: This has to be a valid street address. Eg. It cannot be a PO Box.

country.description: Three-letter alpha-3 country code as defined in the ISO 3166-1 spec. Currently must be passed as "USA".

UsdOfframpWireUSAccount.title: USD Offramp Wire to US Bank Account

currency.description: Currency denomination of the destination bank account. Must be usd.

accountOwnerType.description: Specify 'business' if the account is owned by a business, otherwise 'individual'. If 'business', 'businessName' is required. If 'individual', 'firstName' and 'lastName' are required.

country.description: Three-letter alpha-3 country code as defined in the ISO 3166-1 spec.

ibanAccountNumber.description: The IBAN for the bank account.

accountOwnerType.description: Specify 'business' or 'individual'. Relevant name fields must be provided based on this type.

ibanCountryCode.description: Three-letter alpha-3 country code as defined in the ISO 3166-1 spec.

iban.description: Either a swift account number or iban must be provided.

accountNumber.description: Either a swift account number or iban must be provided.

ibanCountryCode.description: Country in which the bank account is located. It's a three-letter alpha-3 country code as defined in the ISO 3166-1 spec.

businessIdentifierCode.description: The Business Identifier Code (BIC) that will be used to send the funds.

requestId.description: Unique identifier for the transfer request (recommend using uuid v4)

recipientUserId.description: User Id of the recipient (should either provide recipientUserId or recipientAddress)

recipientAddress.description: wallet address of the recipient (should either provide recipientUserId or recipientAddress)

chain.description: Choose POLYGON_MAINNET for production, POLYGON_AMOY for sandbox.

feeValue.description: note: 0.01 equals to 1% when feeType is set to PERCENT, checkout https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/fee-collection for more information)

requestId.description: Unique identifier for the transfer request (recommend using uuid v4)

destinationUserId.description: If destination account was created under the sourceUserId, the destinationUserId will be the same id. You can specify a different destinationUserId if offramping to a bank account created under a different userId than the sender.

destinationAccountId.description: Account Id of the destination bank account

chain.description: Choose POLYGON_MAINNET for production, POLYGON_AMOY for sandbox.

sameDayAch.description: Routes offramp for same day ACH transfer for a $1 additional fee

feeValue.description: note: 0.01 equals to 1% when feeType is set to PERCENT, checkout https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/fee-collection for more information)

wireMessage.description: A message to be sent with a wire transfer, only allowed when the payment rail is a wire. This message will be validated against 4 lines, each with a max length of 35 char according to the Fedwire standard.

achReference.description: A reference message to be sent with an ACH transaction. It can be at most 10 characters, A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and spaces. Note that as of 2024-08-06, setting this field is only supported for certain developers while we work on rolling out general support for everyone.

sepaReference.description: A reference message to be sent with a SEPA transaction. It must be from 6 to 140 characters. The allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, spaces, ampersand (&), hyphen (-), full stop (.), and solidus (/).

swiftReference.description: A payment reference message or remittance information to be included in a SWIFT transaction. It can have at most 4 lines (separated by "\n"), each line with a max length of 35 chars. The allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, special characters (/ - ? : ( ) . , ' +), and spaces.

requestId.description: Unique identifier for the transfer request (recommend using uuid v4)

sourceUserId.description: User which will be pull the fiat bank account from

sourceAccountId.description: Account Id of the source bank account

destinationUserId.description: User which will be receiving the crypto

feeValue.description: note: 0.01 equals to 1% when feeType is set to PERCENT, checkout https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/fee-collection for more information)

requestId.description: Unique identifier for the transfer request (recommend using uuid v4)

sourceUserId.description: User who owns the USD onramp Plaid bank account specified by the `sourceAccountId`.

sourceAccountId.description: Account Id of the USD onramp Plaid bank account.

status.description:
Status of the transfer. See [Transfer](https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/core-api-transfer) for more details.

`CREATED`, `ACCEPTED`, `SUBMITTED`, `CONFIRMED`, `FAILED`, `PENDING`

Status of the transfer. See [Transfer](https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/core-api-transfer) for more details.

`NOT_INITIATED`, `CREATED`, `SUBMITTED_ONCHAIN`, `COMPLETED_ONCHAIN`, `IN_PROGRESS_FIAT`, `INITIATED_FIAT`, `COMPLETED`, `FAILED_ONCHAIN`, 
`FAILED_FIAT_RETURNED`, `FAILED_FIAT_REFUNDED`, `FAILED_UNKNOWN`

Status of the transfer. See [Transfer](https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/core-api-transfer) for more details.

`CREATED`, `FIAT_SUBMITTED`, `FIAT_PROCESSED`, `FIAT_CONFIRMED`, `CRYPTO_IN_REVIEW`, `CRYPTO_SUBMITTED`, `CONFIRMED`, `REFUNDED`, `FAILED`, `FAILED_UNKNOWN`

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth in format yyyy-mm-dd.

taxIdentificationNumber.description: For individual US customers, SSN should be used. For non-US individual customers, a national ID is preferred where applicable; however, a tax ID can also be used as an alternative.

stateProvinceRegion.description: ISO 3166-2 subdivision code. Must be supplied if the country has subdivisions.

postalCode.description: Must be supplied for countries that use postal codes.

country.description: Three-letter alpha-3 country code as defined in the ISO 3166-1 spec.

signedAgreementId.description: ID of the signed agreement, fetched through the HIFI's Hosted Terms of Service Link POST /tos-link.

ipAddress.description:
IP address of the user. 

(See [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/unsupported-regions-countries) for the list of unsupported countries/states.)

govIdFront.description:
URL of image of the front of the user's government issued ID.

*Maximum File Size: 10MB

*Valid file types: .pdf, .jpeg, .jpg, .png, .heic, .tif

govIdBack.description:
Not required for passports. Required for all other ID types. URL of image of the back of the user's government issued ID.

*Maximum File Size: 10MB

*Valid file types: .pdf, .jpeg, .jpg, .png, .heic, .tif

govIdCountry.description:
Alpha-3 country code of the provided government id as defined in the ISO 3166-1 spec. Note that the government ID may be different from the 'country' above.

(See [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/unsupported-regions-countries) for the list of unsupported countries/states.)

proofOfResidency.description:
URL of the file of the proof of residency.
Required for users based in the EU or withdrawing into EU bank accounts.
Required for individuals who provide government ID documents from a controlled or prohibited region and claim residence outside that region.

(See [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/unsupported-regions-countries) for the list of unsupported countries/states.)

*Maximum File Size: 10MB

*Valid file types: .pdf, .jpeg, .jpg, .png, .heic, .tif

templateId.description: Id of the custom terms of service template generated in the HIFI developer dashboard. If not passed, the page will use HIFI's default template.

redirectUrl.description: Url to redirect after accepting the terms of service link. The signedAgreementId is the same as the passed idempotencyKey, you may attempt to call the POST /user/create endpoint, but if the user did not accept the TOS, the user creation will return an error.

SEPA onRamp will be available in near future

balance.description: The raw balance of the wallet in the smallest unit of the token.

displayBalance.description: The user-friendly balance of the wallet formatted to two decimal places.

chain.description: The blockchain network where the token is hosted.

contractAddress.description: The smart contract address of the token.

assetType.description: The type of asset, typically 'ERC20' for Ethereum-based tokens.

quantity.description: The quantity of the token in its smallest unit.

symbol.description: The symbol of the token, such as 'USDC'.

decimals.description: The number of decimal places the token can be divided into.

post.summary: Link Plaid Account for USD Onramp (ACH)
post.description:
HIFI and Plaid have partnered to enable you to link your existing Plaid account to HIFI for USD Onramp with ACH pull. To get started, follow the Plaid [guide](https://plaid.com/docs/api/processors/) to create a Plaid 
processor token. Passing the processor_token to this endpoint will allow you to link your Plaid account for USD onramp.

Linking a Plaid account alone will not allow the user to onramp as onramping requires a Virtual Account. To create a virtual account, you can set the parameter `createVirtualAccount` to `true` in the request body 
or you can create one manually later on through the `Create Onramp Virtual Account` endpoint. Creating a Virtual Account is a billable event.

HIFI will create a virtual bank account for you that allows you to onramp by simply deposit fiat into the bank account.

The created virtual bank account only supports the specified onramp `rail`. eg. ACH and WIRE with USD. If you need to support a different rail, you'll need to generate another virtual bank account for that specific rail.

***Note: Create Virtual Account is a billable event.***

Create a Receiver for Brazilian Real (BRL) Offramp. This should be called prior to 
adding a BRL offramp bank account since each BRL offramp bank account is tied to a receiver.

get.description: Get an existing BRL Offramp Receiver detail.

put.description: Update an existing BRL Offramp Receiver detail.

post.description: Add a Brazilian Real (BRL) Offramp Bank Account to a Receiver. You will need a receiver id to add a bank account to. You can get the receiver id through the `Create BRL Offramp Receiver` endpoint.

get.description: Get an existing onramp or offramp account detail.
Get all existing onramp or offramp account details.
Retrieve the created virtual bank account information. The response will include the desposit instructions and the micro deposit information requested by institution.

post.description: Transfer stablecoins between users or wallet addresses

Transfer crypto to fiat currency and send it to an offramp bank account.

There are two types of transfers, **quote-based** and **non-quote-based** transfers. 
* For **non-quote-based transfers**, the transfers are initiated immediately.
* For **quote-based transfers**, the transfer status will initially be `OPEN_QUOTE`. You have to accept the transfer quote through the `Accept Transfer Quote` endpoint to initiate the transfer.

Quote-based transfers:
  * BRL offramp transfer
Transfer fiat currency from an onramp bank account to crypto.

get.description: Get all the transfer records of a user or all the transfer records under your organization.
Get all the transfer records of a user or all the transfer records under your organization.
Get all the transfer records of a user or all the transfer records under your organization.
Retrieve conversion rate between stablecoin and fiat currency.

put.description:
Accept the transfer quote for quote-based transfers only. 

For example, BRL offramp transfer is a quote-based transfer so its initial transfer status will be `OPEN_QUOTE`. This means you have to accept the transfer quote to initiate the transfer.

post.description: Transfer fiat currency from an USD Onramp Plaid bank account to the specified bank account through ACH pull.

get.description:
Get a single transfer record or all transfer records for a user, a specific transfer type, or all transfer records within your organization.

* To get a **single record**, provide the required `id` and `transferType` parameters only.
* To get **all records**, provide the optional `userId`, `transferType`, `limit`, `createdBefore`, and `createdAfter` parameters only. eg. Providing `userId` and `transferType` will return all transfer records of that user and transfer type.

post.description:
Create a new Hifi user (Individual/Business)

HIFI does not provide services to users or businesses from sanctioned and high-risk regions or unsupported US states. See [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/unsupported-regions-countries) for more info.

put.description:
Update an existing Hifi user.

HIFI does not provide services to users or businesses from sanctioned and high-risk regions or unsupported US states. See [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/unsupported-regions-countries) for more info.

post.description: The Terms of Service page must be displayed to the end user. This page can be whitelabeled upon request.

get.description: Poll this endpoint to get the latest balance of a user's wallet, including details like the blockchain network and currency.
